sentence.Network_en: The Special Group itself was infected with interregnum uncertainties.

sentence.Network_en: He shared Clifford's concern about the interregnum.

sentence.Network_en: There is no interregnum between the death of one sovereign and the accession of the next.
sentence.Network_cn: 君主死亡与下一君主继位之间不得有任何空位期.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting temporary rule between reigns or during suspension of normal government): from Latin, from inter- 'between' + regnum 'reign'

entry.tran: 空位期，过渡期(两任领导人交接的一段时期)
entry.def: An interregnum is a period between the end of one person's time as ruler or leader and the coming to power of the next ruler or leader.

means.word_mean: 1. the time between two reigns, governments, etc.

auth_sentence.content: In that interregnum, don't focus on the copulation but the causation.

auth_sentence.content: Interregnum The interval between the end of a pope's pontificate and the accession of his successor.

auth_sentence.content: During the interregnum, daily general congregations are held, which all cardinals are eligible to attend.
